intro: Angolluma sacculata, commonly known as the desert bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and inflated, seed-containing pods that resemble bladders. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Angolluma sacculata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native insects.
